column4: I have a question regarding my computer recognizing the battery.
Unless the battery is less than 5 min from full charge, the computer shuts down when it's unplugged.
it sounds like you leave your laptop plugged in all the time

It is likely that you need a new battery. Only plugging it in when it's almost dead, and then unplugging when it's fully charged will make it last longer. There is nothing you can do about it, unless it's under warranty
unless of course, it is fine with another currently installed os
it does work fine on Windows
have you checked your power settings under system>preferences?
I take it back. There are other settings somewhere. I don't remember where. Look in synaptic for "laptop"
when it gets unplugged it says 3 min of battery remaining unless plugged back in. still turns off even if it's plugged back in
well that's not right.
what happens if you log in to windows and charge it, then switch back?
It won't turn off if it's fully charged, just below a 90% charge
it sounds like your computer is borked
is there anything noteworthy in the bios related to power?
no, nothing
perhaps a setting for apic or apm
My computer has trouble with a lot of things like this, I cannot update the system, it will crash the OS, and it wasn't until I installed Poulsbo 2d and 3d that I could change screen resolution
Perhaps I should just live with it
perhaps you could shut down, remove the battery for a bit and then plug it back in and charge while powered off. then boot and try again
do you have candlewax, a leatherman, and a pinch of hair?
yes, but this might be a weird fix.
I may know an incantation, but the smell of fire will soothe your soul.
sorry, you'll need a blowtorch too. (jk). It sounds like someone else knows more about poulsomethingsomething than I.
ohsix, Thanks, but I'll just deal with it for now, Plus, big paper due soon. Thanks again
